record.title: PROVIDING FOR A JOINT SESSION OF CONGRESS TO RECEIVE A MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT
record.narrative:
PROVIDING FOR A JOINT SESSION OF CONGRESS TO RECEIVE A MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT -- (Senate - January 24, 2008)

[Page: S301]

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H. Con. Res. 282 just received from the House and at the desk.

record.chair: The clerk will report the concurrent resolution by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 282) providing for a joint session of Congress to receive a message from the President.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the concurrent resolution.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the concurrent resolution be agreed to and the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, without intervening debate or action.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 282) was agreed to.
